main event: On 16 January 1962, a bright orange light was observed in the sky, initially appearing stationary before moving at a high rate of speed.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 2-3 minutes and was seen from Vandalia, Ohio., The object was reported to have a bright orange color and left a trail behind., Witnesses described the object as appearing like an airplane without wings., The sighting was concluded to be a probable aircraft illuminated by the sunset., There were comments suggesting condensation formed by a WAAT jet could explain the sighting.
sighted object: a bright orange light in the sky
witness description: the sighting was reported by a civilian
